intro: Cylindrolobus cyclosepalus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
